Cross-modality feature associations.

Source: R/feature_associations.R
feature_associations.Rd

Learns a feature-level probabilistic mapping from one modality to another using KL divergence minimization with regularization. The optimization is done independently for each feature in A. The result is a sparse matrix showing how features in modality B (columns) associate with features in modality A (rows). The model applies softmax-based weighting with optional entropy and sparsity regularization.

feature_associations(
  A,
  A_var,
  B,
  B_var,
  mask = NULL,
  n_epochs = 10000,
  lambda_reg = 1e-04,
  lambda_entropy = 0.001,
  lambda_spread = 0.05,
  temperature = 0.2,
  normalize = TRUE,
  seed = 1898,
  n_threads = 10
)

Arguments

A

Topic-feature matrix of modality A.

A_var

DataFrame from modality A, used for column names.

B

Topic-feature matrix of modality B.

B_var

DataFrame from modality B, used for row names.

mask

Optional boolean mask (shape: n_features_B x n_features_A) specifying which feature pairs to consider (default: NULL).

n_epochs

Number of optimization steps per target feature (default: 10000).

lambda_reg

Regularization coefficient for sparsity (default: 1e-4).

lambda_entropy

Regularization coefficient for entropy (default: 1e-3).

lambda_spread

Regularization coefficient for weight spread (default: 0.05).

temperature

Softmax temperature for controlling assignment sharpness (default: 0.2).

normalize

Whether to check and normalize A and B to ensure row sums equal 1. (default: TRUE).

seed

Random seed for reproducibility (default: 1898).

n_threads

Number of threads to use for Torch (default: 10).

Value

A data frame of shape (n_features_B, n_features_A) with association weights.

Contents

Developed by Damian Panas, Piotr Rutkowski.
